summary: An internal FBI email chain from August 16, 2019, regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. The email requests personnel to be on standby to assist with interviews following the service of 16 subpoenas.

persons.name: Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.role: FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.context: Author of the initial email requesting 10 people to be on standby to assist with interviews for the Epstein death investigation.

events.title: FBI Request for Interview Assistance
events.description: An FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge emails a team stating that 16 subpoenas have been served as part of the Epstein death investigation and requests 10 people to be on standby to assist with potential interviews on the following Monday or Tuesday.

keyFacts: The document is an internal FBI email dated August 16, 2019, concerning the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The FBI had served 16 subpoenas as part of the Epstein death investigation.
The email requests 10 FBI personnel to be on standby to assist with interviews that may be needed on the following Monday or Tuesday.
The email chain indicates active investigative steps were being taken shortly after Epstein's death.
